list_definition.definition: in prehistoric times, a person who lived in a cave

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Cavemen dressed in the skins of animals.

list_ex_of_english: Since the first caveman learned to control fire, humans have shaped and used light in a constantly expanding array of technologies.
He grunts single words, strung together by pauses in between to form (incomplete) sentences, in par with caveman speech.
He came up with the basic concept of doing it with cavemen in skins.
He gets upset about the tenor of the commercial and its demeaning comments about cavemen, and storms off the set.
Also, tools which cavemen used at those times were discovered.
As the curious adults (there are no children) crowd around her, she attracts the attention of the caveman chief.
Ah (in caveman talk) tells his people that they must show the world who is boss.
He is shown to speak in two different ways: like a normal person, and like a caveman.
